> I used to think this way, too. I found that after a while I didn't care 
> whether I saw "F" or "E": I treated them the same way, so that's why I 
> stopped using the above pattern.
> 
> Do you /really/ troubleshoot differently based on whether you see F or E?

If I were using a tool to run my tests, which I don't currently but I might
someday (say, Eclipse, for example), I would most likely want it to help me
attack failures first; they are occurring under better defined circumstances
and will likely help to fix the errors I'm seeing elsewhere.

I guess, as I see it, the dichotomy is there, semantically, and if I proceed
to collide the two then I'm just making everyone else's job harder and tools
less useful.

- John
